title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: AINMA warns MSME notebook closures as imports rise
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- AINMA warns that over 1,500 notebook MSMEs face closure due to a surge in imports from *ASEAN countries* and an *inverted duty structure* that harms domestic producers and the **Make in India** push.
- They have written to the Finance and Commerce ministries arguing that **zero-tax imports under GST** could undercut local prices and livelihoods.
- S. Saravanakumar of AINMA calls for an urgent corrective mechanism to restore a level playing field and safeguard the notebook ecosystem, aligning with the PM's *swadeshi* vision.

items.title: Blue Energy Motors launches electric heavy-duty truck with battery swapping technology
NMDC Steel first BIS for pipeline-grade hot-rolled steel
items.summary:
- *NMDC Steel* became India's first company to obtain a BIS licence to manufacture pipeline-grade hot-rolled steel under *IS 18384:2023* for Welded Steel Pipe used in pipeline transportation.
- The license was conferred on *World Standards Day 2025* in Raipur, with CMD *Amitava Mukherjee* receiving it in the presence of *Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai*.
- This milestone strengthens domestic capability and aligns with NMDC Steel's Nagarnar 3.0 MTPA plant to meet national and international standards for critical industries.

items.title: Rolls-Royce expands Bharat Forge blade deal
items.summary: - *Rolls-Royce* expands with *Bharat Forge* to manufacture and supply fan blades for Pearl 700 and Pearl 10X, inked at the Dahlewitz facility near Berlin, boosting *Make in India*.\n- The deal builds on Bharat Forge’s Pearl 700 work since 2020, with the first zero-defect blade in 2024, now extending to Pearl 10X.\n- Pearl 10X delivers over 18,000 pounds of thrust, underscoring India’s growing aerospace capability with Rolls-Royce’s long-standing local presence.

items.title: Celcius Logistics & Switch Mobility to launch electric reefer fleet
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- **Celcius Logistics** signs an MoU with **Switch Mobility** to deploy 350 electric light commercial vehicles (**eLCVs**) for refrigerated transport, marking India’s largest bulk order for eLCVs.
- Under the *Celcius Green* vertical, the fleet will start in New Delhi and expand to Mumbai, Bengaluru, and Hyderabad, with ARR targets of ₹50 crore in year 1 and ₹250 crore over five years.
- It includes *GPS live tracking*, humidity/temperature sensors, lane-specific charging, and predictive maintenance, backed by ₹100 crore plus ₹100–150 crore for expansion.

items.title: Blue Dart opens largest integrated ground hub in Haryana
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- Blue Dart opened its largest integrated ground hub in *Pataudi*, Haryana, consolidating operations under one roof to boost connectivity, scalability, and efficiency.
- The 50,558 sqm facility, located ~50 km from Delhi airport, offers *multimodal connectivity* to Delhi-NCR and major expressways, reducing vehicle movement by 30% and raising throughput by ~10–15%.
- Operational through 2033 with automation and motorised conveyors, the hub features an auto sorter of 200,000 shipments/day (2,283 tons daily) and serves 19,000+ pin codes as part of Blue Dart's expanding express network.

items.title: Apple vows to keep its bet on China amid trade tensions
Zetwerk expands BIS-compliant manufacturing in India
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Zetwerk launches BIS-compliant manufacturing at its Noida facility to supply BIS-ready consumer and industrial electrical products, emphasizing *BIS* certification. - The expansion aligns with government norms, accelerating domestic production and helping brands meet mandatory standards for the *Made in India* push. - Leaders say investments in *R&D*, testing, and standardized processes enable scalable, compliant manufacturing and position brands for global reach.

items.title: RHI Magnesita commissions India’s first Robotic Caster System at JSW Vijayanagar
items.summary: - RHI Magnesita commissioned India's first *robotic caster* at JSW Vijayanagar as part of its *4PRO* automation for casting.\n- The system handles 350-tonne ladles, running continuously to reduce human exposure to molten metal and boost safety, efficiency and product quality.\n- Integrated sensors and vision enable real-time monitoring, lowering scrap/rework and contributing to the Indian steel industry's automation push.

items.title: ZF enters Indian railway sector with first gearbox order
items.summary: - ZF Group India will assemble railway gearboxes at its *Coimbatore* facility in *Tamil Nadu*, localising production for India's rail sector and advancing **Make in India**.\n- The first order targets a single-stage spur gear drive for the *Vande Bharat Express*, capable of 70–170 km/h with coupling and reaction-rod systems tailored to this semi high-speed train.\n- The move expands *ZF Group India* beyond automotive driveline into railways, signaling a more sustainable, reliable railway solution strategy for India's growing infrastructure.

items.title: How CJ Darcl is reimagining smart logistics
Ola Shakti: Ola’s entry into energy storage
items.summary: - *Ola Shakti* is a residential energy storage solution from *Ola Electric*, built on the *4680 Bharat Cell* platform, offered in four configurations and designed for Indian homes.\n- The product marks Ola’s move beyond electric mobility and targets the ₹1 lakh crore BESS market, with ambitions to scale to about 5 GWh annual Gigafactory consumption.\n- Specs include up to 98% efficiency, 120–290V input, IP67 weatherproofing, 2-hour charging, 1.5 hours of backup, and app-based monitoring and control.

items.title: BluPine Energy lands 150 MW FDRE from SJVN Green Energy
items.summary: - *BluPine Energy* secures a **150 MW FDRE** project from *SJVN Green Energy* via its SPV **Solarcraft Power India 16 Pvt Ltd** at ₹6.75 per kWh. - The project combines solar, wind and battery energy storage to enable reliable dispatch during peak hours and strengthen grid stability. - A **25-year PPA** underpins BluPine's expanding national portfolio, backed by Actis.

items.title: Jakson Green & Blueleaf fund 840 MW Rajasthan solar
items.summary:
- Jakson Green and Blueleaf Energy secured *financial close* for 840 MW of solar projects in *Bikaner, Rajasthan*, as part of a **1-GW** portfolio.
- The funding, secured with **Axis Bank**, enables construction of the 280 MW + 560 MW Bikaner projects and the Bhawad 140 MW project, speeding commissioning.
- The 1-GW Rajasthan portfolio is expected to power over *1.5 million households* annually and advance India’s energy transition toward adding more than *5 GW* by 2030.

items.title: Archer Aviation to buy Lilium's 300-patent portfolio for $21 million
FSSAI orders removal of 'ORS' from labels
items.summary:
- **FSSAI** directed all States/UTs and Central Licensing Authorities to remove the term *'ORS'* from food products and branding, including trademarks.
- The directive covers standalone use or when *ORS* appears with prefixes/suffixes, and warns that such use can violate the Food Safety and Standards Act, 2006.
- Such products are deemed *misleading* and *misbranded* and attract action under Sections 52 and 53, with immediate compliance required.

items.title: DRDO signs MoU for 300 MW solar projects across establishments
items.summary:
- *DRDO* and **SECI** signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to develop *300 MW* of solar-based renewable energy across DRDO establishments in India.
- The MoU exchange ceremony occurred at DRDO Bhawan in New Delhi, with Dr Samir V. Kamat and Santosh Kumar Sarangi in attendance.
- The agreement aims to establish self-reliant, Net-Zero campuses across strategic DRDO locations by 2027.

items.title: TACC gets SBI ₹1,230 cr funding for Dewas graphite project
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - *TACC Ltd*, a subsidiary of HEG Ltd, **secures** ₹1,230 crore from SBI to build a 20,000 MTPA graphite anode plant in Dewas for *lithium-ion batteries*. - The greenfield project will produce graphite anodes for *EVs* and energy storage, with funding for development and commissioning. - This move strengthens India's domestic capability in advanced energy materials, aligning with the CEO Ankur Khaitan's vision.

items.title: Biomass use in power sector to near triple
items.summary:
- *Samarth Mission Director Anil Baweja* says biomass use in the power sector could reach *2.5 million tonnes* this year, with *1.3 million already utilised*.
- *India* has about *230 million tonnes* of surplus agricultural residue annually, but only around *3.2 million tonnes* is used for energy generation.
- *Torre faction torrefaction* technology and pelletisation, plus co-firing in coal plants, are being promoted to boost efficiency and expand the bioenergy market.

items.title: India, Saudi discuss deeper chemical cooperation
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - The India–Saudi meeting focused on strengthening collaboration in chemicals and petrochemicals, exploring investments, R&D and skill development. - They highlighted complementarities—Saudi Arabia’s petrochemicals strength and India's growing speciality chemicals base—and agreed to boost cooperation across the value chain, including PCPIRs. - They reaffirmed a sustainable, mutually beneficial partnership, noting bilateral trade reached $41.88B in 2024–25, with chemicals and petrochemicals about $4.5B, signaling strong long‑term potential.

items.title: EU conditionally clears Boeing bid for Spirit AeroSystems
items.summary:
- The EU conditionally approved Boeing's **$4.7‑billion** acquisition of *Spirit AeroSystems*, after remedies addressed competition concerns. 
- Commitments include selling Spirit's European operations to **Airbus** and divesting Spirit's Malaysia site to **Composites Technology Research Malaysia** to preserve competition. 
- EU antitrust chief Teresa Ribera said the remedies should allow a new rival to enter the market and keep parts costs at *competitive* levels.

items.title: TCG Crest sodium-ion battery with 5-min charge
items.summary:
- *India's RISE under TCG Crest has developed the country's first indigenous sodium-ion battery with a 94% charge in five minutes.*
- *The cells deliver ~180 Wh/kg energy density and 10 kW/kg power, showing strong cycling stability and high-temperature performance.*
- *Commercial deployment requires scaling to thousands of cycles and higher-capacity cells, aiming for safer, cost-effective, domestically manufactured storage.*

items.title: Kaynes Semicon rolls out India’s first commercially manufactured multi-chip module
India, South Korea ties get stronger with tech-driven partnership in chips, green energy
Scania opens new China manufacturing hub
items.summary:
- Scania opens its first fully owned factory in *Jiangsu, China*, hedging against global uncertainty to serve *Asia* with tailor-made trucks. 
- The project entails a *€2 billion* investment in *China*, employing about *3,000 workers*, aiming for a capacity of *50,000 vehicles*. 
- CEO *Christian Levin* says it lets Scania deliver tailor-made products with short lead times, growing markets as it leverages *free trade agreements* and *Europe*-like hubs.

items.title: Saatvik Green Energy, its arm bag orders worth ₹689.47 cr for the supply of solar PV modules
Sahasra Semiconductors expands portfolio, begins exports of ‘Made in India’ Micro SD cards
Madhya Pradesh drug manufacturing units ordered to halt production following inspections
LG Electronics India to deepen manufacturing, eyes export growth and tier-II expansion
Global auto giant Stellantis to set up EV manufacturing and export hub in Abu Dhabi
Legacy fabs can be the cheat code to India's semiconductor push
GE Aerospace’s Pune facility marks 10 years of operations
Rajasthan HC orders Centre, FSSAI to establish GM food safety standards
EAAA Alternatives to invest up to 400 bn rupees in clean energy over next five years
India, Saudi Arabia bolster cooperation in chemicals and petrochemicals sector
Steel makers’ margins to shrink even as non-ferrous firms gain in Q2
2 drug units in Madhya Pradesh ordered to halt production
Jindal Stainless launches stainless steel salt tipper trailers for safe transportation
Aviation industry's overall supply chain constrained; co making improvements: GE Aerospace exec
Broadcom to launch new networking chip, as battle with Nvidia intensifies
Heavy lift drone maker BonV Aero delivers 20-kg payload over 60 km
items.summary:
- BonV Aero demonstrated a *20-kg payload* delivery over *60 km* in BVLOS, underscoring advancements in heavy-lift drone capabilities.
- The mission lasted 75 minutes at an average speed of **48 km/h**, showcasing mature propulsion and energy systems for high-endurance use.
- This milestone marks a turning point for domestically developed UAVs in Indian drone logistics, enabling long-range, high-payload BVLOS flights.

items.title: India adds 4.9 GW rooftop solar capacity under PM Surya Ghar scheme; only 13% of target met
Innovation through regulation: QCOs and the future of sustainable FMCG
Aurubis, US talks on new copper smelter
items.summary: - *Aurubis* has held preliminary talks with the *US government* about support for a new *copper smelter* in the United States, after launching a *Georgia recycling plant*. - CEO *Toralf Haag* says a new smelter is a long‑term project, but there are positive signs of potential government backing; near‑term options include expanding the *US recycling operation* or adding a *West Coast plant* that could occur in 3–4 years without aid. - *US demand* for smelting is strong, with about 60 smelters in China and 15 in Europe vs only ~3 in the US, while Aurubis also plans a €500m *Hamburg refinery/recycling complex* to boost *platinum* and *antimony* output.

items.title: WPI inflation in Sept at 0.13% vs 0.52% Aug
items.summary: - *WPI inflation in September 2025 is **0.13% YoY**, driven by price gains in *manufactured food products*, *non-food articles*, *textiles*, and *transport equipment*.*\n- *On a month‑on‑month basis, WPI fell by **0.19%** from August to September 2025.*\n- *Manufactured products rose **2.33% YoY**, while the WPI Food Index slipped to **-1.99% YoY**; Primary Articles and Fuel & Power also eased.*

items.title: India's smartphone exports jump 95% to $1.8B in Sep
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- September smartphone exports rose over 95% YoY to about *$1.8 billion*, per **ICEA**. 
- Apr–Sep 2025 exports hit *$13.5 billion*, up over *60%*, signaling sustained scale in India’s mobile-phone ecosystem. 
- The US accounts for nearly *70%* of Apr–Sep exports, at about *$9.4 billion*, with **ICEA** forecasting around *$35 billion* in FY2025-26.

items.title: L&T partners with Foxconn unit for high-voltage wafers
items.summary:
- **L&T Semiconductor Technologies** has partnered with Foxconn subsidiary **Hon Young Semiconductor (HYS)** to jointly develop **high-voltage wafers (650V–3,300V)**.
- **HYS** provides wafer foundry services for **SiC** and **Si** platforms, enabling collaboration on wafer fabrication for automotive and industrial power solutions with LTSCT's expertise.
- The collaboration will leverage HYS facilities in Taiwan to tailor wafers for automotive/industrial use and build an India-based semiconductor portfolio.

items.title: Chipmaker Nexperia says banned from exporting from China
items.summary:
- Nexperia says *China* banned its exports of goods *manufactured in China* after the Dutch government seized control amid *mismanagement* concerns.
- The company says it is actively engaging with authorities in *Beijing* to obtain an exemption from China's counter-measures.
- The Dutch government invoked a Cold War-era law to take control, with *Wingtech Technology*'s shares placed under an independent administrator.

items.title: Google's gigawatt data-centre aligns with Viksit Bharat
items.summary:
- PM Modi highlighted Google's **gigawatt-scale compute capacity** and the Visakhapatnam AI hub as a key pillar of India's **Viksit Bharat** plan.
- Google announced an AI hub in Visakhapatnam with roughly **$15 billion** investment (2026–2030), including a gigawatt-scale data centre campus and energy infra.
- Developed with AdaniConneX and Airtel, the project aims to democratise AI, boost the digital economy, and cement India’s role as a global tech leader.

items.title: GE Pune facility boosts local high-end manufacturing
items.summary:
- GE Pune is a *ten-year hub* for *jet-engine components* and *advanced skills*, supplying GE90/GE9X/LEAP parts.
- Pune centers *high-value manufacturing* and *skilling*, training 5,000+ associates via apprenticeships, with lean *Flight Deck* operations.
- Last year, ₹240 crore expansion; Bengaluru's 25-year John F Welch Centre; over 1,400 GE/CFM engines power Indian carriers.
